review_blob: This caught me off guard as I was expecting grapefruit rind style bitter but was very satisfied with the smooth mild Id say sweetness over bitter. The maltiness iS spot on and iS carbonated well. The head iS small and the color when poured iS a nice red hue. The aroma iS mellow and sweet pretty much like the brew itself. Overall this iS what I was looking for and not an over bitter brew. On the side this brew iS good cold but iS better half way through as it warms up slightly.

Currently drinking: The aroma seems to be of fruits such as apricot and plums...grape as well. The flavor iS quite powerful it tastes more vegetarian than like fruit which was a tragic mislead for myself. The mouth feel iS a nice tingle with warming alcohol that iS well hidden but the bitter lingering aftertaste of seemingly celery leaves me to give this a seemingly low ranking for this brew. Everybody has different tastes.

This brew here fits my tastes in just about every way. First off after opening the bottle I noticed the sweet ginger aroma that was not overwhelming but very present along with a nice yeast and malt scent. The flavor iS smooth, the head was thin, and the silkiness lingers on with the presence of ginger and honey. Overall a good drink that I wanted to buy more of.

This brew pours a dark brown with a tan foamy head consisting of tiny bubbles. The aroma iS a mix of what seems to be chocolate, coffee, and malts. The alcohol iS very well hidden making this a delight to drink. Terrible? Hardly...only terrible if you pass it up for a first try.

Nice pine citrus aroma to it. The mouth feel is on the thick side but it tingles with the astringent fruits and gets better as it goes down. Not overly bitter like most hop-full beers are rather sweet. This possibly creates the thick caramelish inmouth palate coating with maltiness to it. Overall highly drinkable but to get best effects let it warm up a touch....I found that out too late.

Yes. Very nice. The nose was subtle as grapes can be the honey mellow and a very nice touch of malts. Well defined palate of grapes with an almost creamy smooth honey sticky feel but not overdone. More refreshing and crisp than thick or syrupy...that needed cleared; VERY FINE! Perfect 5.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Got the 12 pack of the testers. This stood out the most of them due to the highly unexpected flavor in here. I mostly tasted the apricot possibly peach most of all. Very nice in mouth feel, its thin crisp and refreshing. Im starting to really like this type of fruit beers. Nice sweet aroma.
This brew has a nice malty palate. Very smooth no harshness, no alcohol detected as its very well hidden. By far one of the best stouts Ive ever had. The carbonation is nearly perfect....

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: This is a smooth brew. It keeps you guessing as to the ABV% because in taste alone it is not high in noticability. I did like the bitter-sweet thing it has going on in there. Starts out hoppy and ends in malts. The scent to this is sweet malts and hops. The color was deep red orange with white-light pink head (could be reflections). The palate was smooth and thin not thick, not syrupy. Nice and thin and even quenching. It ended on a carmelish note for me. A great brew for me just randomly picking one out I havent tried yet!

This brew while a good one isnt absolutely excellent. While I regret having to do this I cant compromise my tastes either. Heres the rating. It has a more sweet, then sour aroma. I didnt know what to expect. This brew is a red, but mostly orange-yellow clear brew. Has carbonation that is good. A semi-sweet to bitter after taste. The in-mouth feel is low-thick and syrupy. However for 10.5% ABV is very very nice. Hmmm....I just cant pin-point anything else other than it does coat the palate pretty thickly and alcohol is not noticable; its there but cant taste it well; good.

If I seem nice on my ratings maybe its because I have different tastes and have chosen good brews by luck that and the specific store I go to to get these underground brews know how to hook it up. Thanks Randy! This brew is still rockin. Not yet near an 180 degree tilt. Poured in glass a nice clear orange-red with lots of carbonation bubbles. Little head. Aroma was sweet, berry was detectable as is the malts. In mouth is very thin, coats the palate medium, goes down really smooth, follows with berry sweetness. Crisp, refreshing and great as well as complex. Cheers.....

One great brew to try and buy. I dont know what I was expecting from this. Maybe something like the other Barley Wine I tried. It was not like it at all. It was better......way better. This is a highly drinkable brew. Very smooth on all fronts. Well balanced and time was taken to craft this. I couldnt tell by the packaging the ABV% but its smoothness led me to believe it was around 7-8% when its 10.5%.....definitely unexpected. Its either that or I dont know the rule to Barley Wines. A great brown/red depending light angle.....also a strong hint of barley and malts with some fruit? Hops are non-existent in flavor but present in effect...I think. The head is light brown to tan/white and medium. Pretty bubbly and thick. Very nice on all edges and beats the other Barley Wine (ale style) on my list hands down! A great trick to pull on someone who likes a certain %ABV by prejudice and not taste as the % is not labled anywhere on box or bottle label so maybe this is the brew to get others to like the micros. Not trying but I found another 5 for my list of brews....also a great buy for the price!

This brew has a major hops kicks to it. I like it. It pours a deep ruby red, not dark ruby red; red. Has a medium thick head with lots of bubbles and a tannish overtone to its head. The carbonitation is great. The in mouth feel is medium light, not thick or syrupy. It does have a bit of a floral hoppy aftertaste but in general is smooth all the way around. After number brew 2 you either hate or love it.....I love it. It has a bit of a bitter after taste that lasts for a LONG time (tens of minutes).....but in a good way. The aroma is that of (to me) pure maltiness and yeast. Tasting the alcohol....if you consider hops alcohol-ish youre wrong (is almost non-present). There is almost no alcohol if any present in this monster of a brew! Me being from Southern Cali......rock on Sur Califas!!! A perfect 5

This is another spectacular Dogfish Head brew. While my olfactory might be a bit off it aroma is like sweetened celerary and vegetables mixed with orange peels and some othe citrus. The taste is also a bit vegetable. I mean that in a very good way....because I normally hate veggies.. The in mouth feel is smooth, crisp, clear, and sweet, not to mention mid-high-thickness. No syrupy flavours here; yet I do hint at the orange peels and ?possibly? other slight citruses.. The finish is crisp and smooth and goes down without problems...none. A slight pallette coating but so thin it dissolves fast and begs for another sip. For 10%ABV This and "Burton Baton" of Dogfish Head get a perfect 5. Also FYI The store was only alowing one per person...and they know who we are....because they only got 6 fifths of it....dang. Its also a bit bubbly but not overly done.....perfect!!!! The one reason why I didnt give it a fullon 5 is because of the vegetable flavour. The Appearance is a bright orange/red/yellow; sunset colors (of the sun itself and transparent to translucent). With a medium light head that is white and bubbly. A beer to impress your finest guests with....if you can find a way around the 1 per person per bottle thing. But for what it is....up that one pallate flavour mark making this a perfect beer! Thanks Dogfish Head for Brewing for such a treat! And if I hear this is an experiment....please make more! Overall grade : highly satisfied. Style points (if I were allowed to give them would be a 10).

Aight...this is my overal rating...some have had better if I can remember their names....and others met theri demise. This has not reached its demise. To me its plain and simple, not even complex. It has a bittersweet aroma. Bitter then sweet in order. The flavour is that of a tart raison. I grew up around raisons....more preferrably being called grapes until de-hygronized. Dehydrated. Its not bad but compares nothing to such items as Dogfish Head Raison D Etre. Sorry guys I wanted to blast you off but it seems that you fell off. What that means is between you and I.

4pack of 12ozs $13.57. Smells of sweetened oak then extremely light hops although the hops are extremely present but well hidden. Pours a very bright amber with a thick head and very bubbly; very. The in mouth feel is medium thick and a bit syrupy but all for the better as it is not very thick or even extremely thick. The flavour is amazing and its complexity is WOW. I taste no hops at all yet this is what I do taste; a possibly charred oak flavour with sweetness and absolutely NO alchohol as it is hidden by a honey-ish wood flavor. The finish is very sweet and and a great thick coating on the palate. Possibly the most complex brew I have had and with absolutely NO taste of bitterness. Will buy again when available. I can have any brew I ask for thanks to Randy my new hookup for craft brews anything at or under 13 ABV% Even if not supposedly available in the entire state.....he is a true hook up. In which I say thanks Randy!! Look for the nuclear green top with the tradiational Dogfish Head Symbol in a black triangle....itll blow you away....or maybe change your mind. Although he special ordered this for me and there is none available at the time it is amazing!!!!! A perfect 5 rating!

This is a spectacular brew. I also speak for 3 people here so let it commence: The brews smell was that of grapefruit and hops. The flavour is bitter but not astringent. More of the grapefruit is present than other citrus hints....I am in tuned to grapefruit as it is one of my fav. citruses. There is a bit of tartness but not bitter and follows to a clean finish begging for aother sip. The head is white and semi-thick (translucent) and pours a gorgeous golden-orange. The inital taste is that of bitterness then finishes cleanly with a bit of palate coating citrus. In my eyes a good finish. My brothers analysis of this was a bitter aroma in which he could smell the hops with a flavor of grapefruit but not overwhelming. One he said he would not go out and order specifically but definately drink if the bar was open so to speak. My sister-in law said the aroma was that of peaches....where my brother and I wer like "okay where did that come from?" It did not fit a girls taste as much as ours. This is a near perfect beer yet again raising my hopes for DarkLord day. If you want a palate clenser or complexifier try drinking a bit of 100% ruby red grapefruit juice with it. It WILL change the flavor dramatically. I know because I am on number 2 and wanted to experiment. This is not the most extreme brew I have been able to drink ABV% wise but overall a fine brew. $10 per 22oz will however keep me from buying mass quantities.----Overall concensentuious is a drinkable brew in which my brother could actually finish...as could I. Thank you FFF for an amazing experience and a memorable one at that. Simply superb and fitting in the top 15 brews from around the world. My siss olfactory is the only X factor therefore not allowing this to be a perfect 5.....for which I am sorry. Otherwise it is perfect!!!!

This is a nice lager. It is very smooth and very clean upon the finish. Well balanced however things do stick out but not in a bad way as I tasted a bit of maltiness and possibly the combo of carmolate (the combination of chocolate and caramel.) A fine brew I can definately get more of.

The first thing that hit me when un-capped was its promising lemonish slightly sweet slightly sour aroma. My initial taste caught the full on lemon flavor. While I do like lemons this has a lot of influence by them. The finish is lemony of course and crisp then smooths out to a clean mouth. Very light if you ask me; meaning not thick and syrupy...now if I were actually able to taste it in the blazing hot summer it might be different. For some reason I wanted to try this in the middle of a light blizzard.

This is a delightful brew. Please forgive the lacking of terminology here but its quite simple. This beer is semi-complex and very well balanced. Nothing sticks out while in mouth but the lingering aftertaste is sweet and possibly that of cinnamon or similar spices, yet mild and not thick.

This is really one sweet beer in literal terms. It has a light nose of raisin and I was having doubts after having their 60min IPA but this proved to be much better. Yes I will say it. It tasted like raisin. It finished like raisin and was light in the mouth with a lasting flavor of....you guessed it raisin. If you really like raisins try this one as you will not be dissapointed.

I am really stuck here for multiple reasons but heres an accurate deScription since I am trying some now. First off the aroma: A medium-powerfull but still not overwhelming aroma with a touch of fruit and sourness. It pours a thick medium to bright orange and thick meaning cloudy; you cant see through this one but it does glow a nice color with light behind + a slight head. The taste for the ABV% is; if I may make a comparison a far cry better than "Camo Black Ice" a FAR cry better. The alcohol is well hidden but by a bitter-sweet and back to bitter but not bitter meaning nasty flavor and is complex. In mouth its thick but not overly thick and a little syrupy but still not overdone. They seem to have taken their time developing this recipe in which I say thanks for showing that not all 10%ABV and above tastes not very good but its still not the best flavor wise...it is however my first Barley Wine and this may have something to do with it as Im usually an Ale fan weather its an IPA or not (which is why I picked up this Barley Wine Ale Style), a lager, and porter fan. For experimenting out of the box so to speak its not bad into itself but against others is where you get my rating. The finish is very smooth almost a 10 second linger then absolutely nothing, and no I cant place what is in here at all; its pretty complex and possibly not meant to be totally de-ciphered. This is a very crafty brew. This is a first impression rating. To those of you at Weyerbacher you are now my benchmark for Barley Wines....can anyone top you? Well find out but I also am not bias; never have been never will be...must keep an open mind and palate. Cheers to getting more both when I can and want it to effect me in a hurry! Hmmm the tip of my tongue feels funny...oh wait Im just a blithering idiot...dont listen to me.

I didnt know what to expect from this one but I found out. The aroma is very mild; very. However when caught has a sour note to it. It pours into a glass a medium-dark golden orange with a good amount of head; almost none. The flavor is also mild but in a very good way. The taste is malty and crisp. The in mouth feel is more medium than heavy or light The finish is very smooth and lingering which is another good quality of it. Super slight chocolate undertones to balance the maltiness. Overall a super brew once again raising my hopes for DarkLord day. My palate accepts this brew with the full conviction of my rating but consider me as the X factor as I may have a slightly different taste for brews. 3Floyds has it going good! Also Im trying some right now but that is not the sole reason for this seemingly high score from me. It just fits my tastes.
beer_name: Three Floyds Robert The Bruce Scottish Ale

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: This is a beer to be enjoyed in a not too frequent way. I did like the nutty flavor and its aroma was slightly on the weak side and really didnt know what to expect from its taste. It tasted of slight caramel and malts.

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: I was suprised by this ones creamy taste. The aroma was that of chocolate and hinted at the cream. I must agree that the chocolate malts are very present here. Its not thick or syrupy in fact it finishes well with the lingering of cream then chocolate-cream mix. I guess since Im sort of a choco-holic this fits my tastes well.

This one left me with a good impression however it was a bit in limbo and heres why. The aroma was that of sweet caramel. The flavor though wasnt what I was expecting since I had OLH first. Like OLH and its strong chocolate flavor this one lacked the strong caramel flavor. It is there you just have to find it. Still its one I could get more of.

Maybe its just me and my liking of chocolate. This totally fits my tastes. The aroma was that of malts and powerfull chocolate but not overwhelming. The taste is a combination of chocolate and malts which I truly like. Even the finish is chocolate, carmelish and nutty. A fine brew.

A sweet to bitter aroma with almost no hint of hops; almost. In the mouth it tasted very citrusy and a bit floral. Finish is that of mostly sweet hops and hints of some kind of citrus possibly orange. I can withstand more of this.
beer_name: Great Lakes Burning River Pale Ale

review_blob: This is a pretty good seasonal beer. It has a sweet aroma with notes of cinnamon. The brews mouthfeel is thick and syrupy. On finish you get a strong thick lingering of cinnamon which to me is not bad at all. Still Im glad it only comes around once a year so I dont get tired of it.

Simply put I would not go out and buy a bunch of this because it is just a little too bitter for me and it needs more of the fruity qualities I taste. That may make it more palletable for me. Not exactly up to my tastes.

With a name like it has it definately holds up to its name. The aroma was that of citrus and very slight hop hint. I was maybe expecting it to be the other way around. The taste caught me unexpectedly also I was expecting to actually taste the hops but the hide it well with the grapefruit and other citrus notes extremely well. Almost no sweetness to it from the hops. A powerfull bitter taste that in the mouth is very smooth and finishes cleanly overall with a lingering hint of citrus. A beer to get more of because it fits my citrus-hops taste.

I had to try the 22oz of this. At first I thought it was black then held it up to a light and its a very dark ruby red. The aroma was sweet and malty. The flavor caught me off guard because I could taste the maltiness of it yet the sweet hoppiness. Its still a good brew.
beer_name: Three Floyds Alpha Klaus Christmas Porter

review_blob: Great brew all around. The mix of bitterness and citrus blend together here for an unexpected treat of a good beer. You can tell hops are present but seemingly no aroma of them and strangely not overpowering in flavor either which is good meaning that for me its balanced well.

Not the best dogfish head brew Ive had the chance to try. I guess I was expecting more from it. It was bitter then sweet perhaps a little too much of each for my tastes. I only got this because the 90 minute was out of stock.

The aroma threw me off a little bit because I couldnt pinpoint from citrus or hops, both were present. Pours a great color orange. The flavor is very well balanced by citrus hints and a floral hops note. Goes down very smooth and finishes clean leaving a dry non bitter not sweet taste. For me this an outstanding beer that has left a good impression.
